name: Heritance Ahungalla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from our honeymoon - a week in the Maldives(paradise) followed by a week in Sri Lanka staying in the Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel is beautiful just like any hotel in a major city let it be London, Dublin or New York so if its traditional Sri Lankan style your looking for than its not for you.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but not for us The Downeys, Cork Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was looking out onto the ocean however the water was unfortunately too rough for swimming. There wasn't a soul on the beach for the entire duration of our trip apart from the usual hawkers who camp out on the beach for the day in the hope of selling the odd sarong or two.
reviews.title: paradise

likes.disliked: — reception staff couldn't find me a Durian fruit(out of season)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was nice but became extremely repetitive when your there for 6 days, bearing in mind there's nothing outside the hotel so no chance of eating anywhere else. If you like a drink and a bit of a buzz at nite then this is also not the hotel for you, the bars have no atmosphere.Your not encouraged to go out of the hotel however saying that there's nothing to go out for in the line of entertainment, shopping or eating just a little shop across the road which sells water and snacks which may come in handy as hotels prices are the same if not even more expenive than home. Once you walk out of the hotel you'll be surrounded by hawkers trying to sell you tours which can be annoying as they're fairly persistent.
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.liked: — The views, the pool, the room and the wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on a local tour by tuk tuk with Raji who camps out outside the hotel or beach, his English is perfect which helps. This was quite enjoyable apart from being brought to two different shops trying to get us to buy stuff, this is standard procedure if u take a tuk tuk anyway. We did the nearby river safari which we booked through our travel rep. This would be very managable and much cheaper to do by travelling by tuk tuk and hopping on a boat when you get there, just a few mins down the road. We also went to a national park spotting elephants, about 9 hrs in a car but enjoyable all the same.All of the staff in the hotel were outstanding very friendly and pleasant. Sri Lanka is really just a country for touring around, the ideal would be 4 or 5 days seeing the sights staying in a different hotel ever nite. As part of a tour I would defintely recommend a nite or two in this hotel but def no longer.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.text: Just got back from the Heritance and had a marvellous time there.It is beautifully designed,with two infinity pools leading your eye out to the sea.Our room had a great sea view and was very well furnished.Beds were comfy and the bathroom was great-I want a wet room like theirs!!!Premiership matches on the box and two english speaking movie channels.
reviews.title: Good for relax

reviews.text: we travelled here with our two sons, 13 and 16, in 2001, as a two centre with the maldives, this was our first stop. firstly sri lankan airlines was the best airline we had ever travelled on, even better than virgin.
reviews.title: a country you should visit

likes.disliked: — a long way from the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel then was called the triton, which we was upgraded from after we complained, before we travelled, as our original hotel, the swanee, was slated in a telly programme.
reviews.title: One word...SPECIAL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel was first rate.it's own elephant, numerous weddings going on. beautiful food, even curry for breakfast, if you wished ! ice carving and fruit carving to watch. little chipmunks running all over the place, don't touch them though. a bloke rescued one from the swimming pool, got bit, and was taken to hospital for a rabies jab.
reviews.title: One of the Best Beach resorts I have been to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: sea rough, just paddle and jump the waves. swimming pools good. would watch a large monitor lizard some days, it would wander and then start digging, sadly eating turtle eggs, it was digging up, but hey, that's nature.lots of other little lizards around. and many insects, didn't see any spiders though.
reviews.title: Overall a good experience

reviews.text: took a taxi, they are friendly and cheap, please give them a tip, they work for very low wages, especially the staff at the hotel, my husband gave a bloke that was cleaning up round the pool, a few dollars and he said it was more than he earned in a week !
reviews.title: Amazing beach, lovely hotel, good food if you know where to look

likes.liked: — spacious, modern rooms with excellent views of the beach and sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kuoni rate this hotel as 4.5 stars...uhhhmm im not convinced..
reviews.title: High expectations...

reviews.text: First impressions are good as it has a stunning entrance, palm trees, flood lit pond and a huge lobby. Walking through the lobby you are presented with the main pool and wooden boat, stunning at sunset.
reviews.title: Overpriced and definately not luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: The couple we travelled with got a great room overlooking the pool and beach, we were given a dark corner terrace room overlooking a tree (I would recommend requesting a sea facing room if possible), we were not best pleased so ended up looking at some other rooms until we found one that warranted the sea view we were after. Admittedly they did their best to please. The rooms are nice, very comfortable with a tasteful Indonesian/Asian theme, air con, rain shower, some English TV Channels.
reviews.title: Beautiful design

likes.disliked: — Touts on the beach - just don't utter a word to them or they'll be all over you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: I would say average, certainly not 4/5 star. A lot of luke warm food served and as mentioned in other posts food is at 4/5 star prices. Breakfast was a good spread buffet but the other restaurants in resort became painful by the end of the holiday due to poor food and service.
reviews.title: Over-rated, over-priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: I forget exactly how many times we asked twice/three times for our food. One ‘in room dining experience’ left us with a beef burger without beef in it? This isn’t aimed at all of the staff, some of them are exceptional (eg: Rukmal the Bar Captain and the drinks guys) but generally within the restaurants the pace is slow and not very alert. On our last day 1 waiter was serving the entire pool area and yet 6 staff were behind the reception desk doing what exactly!?! I also felt, as have others that they were constantly after a tip (this is generally the rule of thumb in and out of the hotel)
reviews.title: A truly 5 Star experience at much cheaper rate!

likes.liked: — The Fantastic rooms , the pool the pool the pool , The size of the hotel makes it very relaxed even when occupancy is high!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel from the start, we were in a standard room(301) booked through Kuoni with front sea facing balcony and side pool facing balcony. We opted for half board so did not try the coffee shop or fine dining restaurant. Plenty of choice of good quality food but as usual with buffet style food could have been hotter. Excellent, huge pool, did not make use of beach but apparently a few problems with currents. Good facilities all round, enjoyed the hospitality of the Mirror Bar with big screen and good music. Could not fault the staff at all, always plenty on hand, very polite and friendly and not obviously seeking tips. We were entertained to Christmas carols from the children of a local orphanage which was a delight. Highly recommend but regret unseasonal wet weather and not winning the test match at Galle.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we i read the inital review for this hotel i read all about eh room that smelt of mold. Well imagine my amusement(not ) after God knows how many hours of travel we arrive....hotel looks lovely...we check in...all good. We get showed to our room - we get showed around and then everyone stands still as the expected tip needs to be handed over. Fine, not great but fine. I then start having an asthma attack, due to the strong smell of mold. Yep I've got the moldy room!!!! We ask to get moved, which was quick and efficient, but i was really annoyed when another tip was expected. At this point i have to say that ws one of my main annoyances about Sri Lanka. of course when you travel to a less fortunate country you expect to tip, but i got out hand.
reviews.title: Appreciated it in the end

likes.liked: — beach and the waffles at breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, hotel was ok...room was nice, good size, bathroom great...Again slight annoyance, they cleaned everyday, but i didn't always think it was that thorough-.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The food was fabulous, although we never had the buffet dinner,we ate mainly (when at the hotel) at the 24 h place. the top resturant wasn't open as the hotel wasn't busy enough.Brekafast were wide ranging and very tasty no complaints here.
reviews.title: Stunning

likes.liked: — Truly beautiful hotel in every aspect

description: Welcome to a beach hotel where style and substance mix like a classic cocktail. Just as the turquoise infinity pool seems to blend into the ultramarine Indian Ocean, award-winning cuisine fuses the best of east and west. Welcome to Heritance Ahungalla, where we weave a little magic into your holiday memories while promising you the finest hospitality and best luxury services among Sri Lanka beach hotels.
